decision_conditions: The crown lifting works hereby approved shall only involve the careful removal of epicormic growth from the trunk. Older branches which form the crown structure shall not be removed or pruned. The work shall only be carried out strictly in accordance with British Standard 3998 [2010] 'Tree Works'.Reason: In the interests of the health, safety and appearance of the preserved trees.
This consent is valid for two years.Reason: In order that the nature of work pertaining to this consent remains appropriate.

Tree work should not be carried out during periods that are likely to interfere with or disturb breeding birds or mammals.Reason: In order to comply with the requirements of the Wildlife and Countryside Act (1981) and Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations (2010).

The proposed works would have a negative impact upon the tree's health, and the tree's amenity value. The application form has "Yes" selected, when asked if the reasons for carrying out the proposed works are due to the condition of the tree(s) but the required information has not been submitted. In the absence of this to demonstrate the necessity of the proposals, the stated reasons for the work are considered unjustified.

LOHERA Name: Broadwalk Paving- Address: The Broadwalk- Type: Footway- Local Heritage Asset: This is a rare surfacing of a significant stretch of road, only adopted by Southgate Urban District Council  in 1938. Broad Walk links the Winchmore Hill Conservation Area with Bourne Hill, forming the south east boundary of Grovelands Park. The resident

description: Works to oak trees covered by LBE ORDER NO (181 ) 1986 - PROPOSAL A (T1 , T2, T3) crown lift to provide up to 5m clearance between ground level and the lowest remaining foliage, PROPOSAL B (T1) crown reduce by up to 1.5m all round retaining furnishing growth, (T2) Crown reduce by up to 2m from branch tips all round, no pruning cuts to be greater than 60cm diameter, retain furnishing growth to keep natural outline, (T3) reduce height by up to 2m from branch tips to re-establish crown, reduce laterals by up to1.5m from branch ends.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
